page.title: 07THE HOLIDAYS PROJECT.
page.content: The long summer holiday can be boring for many yong people.In 1985 to help youngsters pass the time Fenland District Council organised a programme of activities for a wide range of interests.The programme was known as the Holidays Project.The Interaction Theatre Group from Milton Keynes visited the Project for the first time.The Football Association provided a qualified coach to help improve Soccer skills on a course costing Â£3.If the families coud not afford the cost then the Council paid the fee.A popular BICYCLE MOTOR CROSS (BMX) circuit was constructed in Wisbech Park for riders aged 10-13.Playleaders were on hand to organise children at to play grounds in the town.
